properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:50PM PST until February 4 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 15 to 30 mph with
gusts up to 40-50 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing
temperatures as low as 28 possible.

* WHERE...North Bay Interior Valleys.

* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 4 AM PST Monday. For the
Freeze Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
